module.p:
bodach ann am monadh an old man on a moor –
Tha am bodach anns a’ mhonadh leis a’ chù.
The old man is on the moor with the dog. td. 21 [229]

cìobair ann am monadh a shepherd on a moor –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank. td. 76

caora ann am monadh a sheep on a moor –
Bha mi anns a’ mhonadh an dé. Chunnaic mi caoraich agus crodh anns a’ mhonadh.
I was on the moor yesterday. I saw sheep and cattle on the moor. td. 21

crodh ann am monadh cattle on a moor –
Bha mi anns a’ mhonadh an dé. Chunnaic mi caoraich agus crodh anns a’ mhonadh.
I was on the moor yesterday. I saw sheep and cattle on the moor. td. 21
An do chuir Calum an crodh do’n mhonadh? Chuir.
Did Malcolm put the cattle to the moor? Yes, he did. td. 47

cù ann am monadh a dog on a moor –
Lean an cù mi do’n mhonadh.
The dog followed me onto the moor. td. 47

fang ann am monadh a fank on a moor –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank. td. 76

nead ann am monadh a nest on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Thàinig iad gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach. Cha do ghlac Seumas breac ach fhuair Màiri nead anns an fhraoch.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They came to a burn and James started fishing. James didn’t catch a trout but Mary found a nest in the heather. td. 76

allt ann am monadh a burn on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Thàinig iad gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach. Cha do ghlac Seumas breac ach fhuair Màiri nead anns an fhraoch.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They came to a burn and James started fishing. James didn’t catch a trout but Mary found a nest in the heather. td. 76

fraoch ann am monadh heather on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Thàinig iad gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach. Cha do ghlac Seumas breac ach fhuair Màiri nead anns an fhraoch.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They came to a burn and James started fishing. James didn’t catch a trout but Mary found a nest in the heather. td. 76

maigheach ann am monadh a hare on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Leum maigheach a mach as an fheur agus ruith i gu luath suas a’ bhruthach.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] A hare jumped out of the grass and it ran swiftly up the slope. td. 76

feur ann am monadh grass on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Leum maigheach a mach as an fheur agus ruith i gu luath suas a’ bhruthach.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] A hare jumped out of the grass and it ran swiftly up the slope. td. 76

bruthach ann am monadh a slope on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Leum maigheach a mach as an fheur agus ruith i gu luath suas a’ bhruthach.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] A hare jumped out of the grass and it ran swiftly up the slope. td. 76

tolman ann am monadh a hillock on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. Thug Seumas leis an t-slat-iasgaich agus thug Màiri leatha biadh ann am bascaid. [...] Nuair a bha an t-acras orra, shuidh iad air tolman agus ghabh iad am biadh a bha aig Màiri anns a’ bhascaid.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. James took the fishing rod with him and Mary took (with her) food in a basket. [...] When they were hungry, they sat down on a hillock and they took the food that Mary had in the basket. td. 76

beinn ann am monadh a mountain on a moor –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. td. 146

ruig ... monadh ... reaches a moor –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank. td. 76

lean ... do’n mhonadh ... follows ... onto a moor –
Lean an cù mi do’n mhonadh.
The dog followed me onto the moor. td. 47

cuir ... do mhonadh ... puts ... onto a moor –
An do chuir Calum an crodh do’n mhonadh? Chuir.
Did Malcolm put the cattle to the moor? Yes, he did. td. 47

coisich ... air monadh ... walks on a moor –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. td. 146

li.gd: Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé.
li.tr: Mary and James were on the moor yesterday.
